Author: artemciy_dice#0049
Content:
> `you would have to keep the web page open during swaps though, no way around that`

With the Push API we can wake the client application even when it isn't opened in the browser. The open question so far is whether a network of normal MM2 servers will be able to support a network of web-native MM2 apps. I hope we'll come closer to answering it during the MM2 port.

Author: jusoaresf#3291
Content: Wouldn't the browser still need to be open (i.e. the session "live") ?

Author: artemciy_dice#0049
Content:
That depends. On mobile any app can be started in background by a Push notification, including the browser-based web apps. (The OS can stop a mobile app any time, so we needed a way to manually kick them up when necessary).
On desktop some browsers would like to do the same ( cf. https://developer.chrome.com/extensions/declare_permissions#background; https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=402456 ).

Author: DLT Novice#2835
Content:
I think it would be great if SuperNet and Heat were aiming for more mutual collaboration... Supernet has Agama wallet that covers 95% of all tokens but lacks liquidity. Heatwallet strives to also cover many of the current crypto tokens. Supernet is for anonymity and safety security. Heat is for speed and efficiency. Both are Decentralized exchanges with universal wallets to hold crypto assets. Both offer ICO plans for private use of their tech in private chains. Both Supernet Komodo and Heat Ledger are striving to take over the ICO industry from ETH. Supernet does Decentralized ICOs Dicos... and Heat for Legal security issuances, ICOs, IPOs... The alignment is close to exact in purpose, but in their differences.. Supernet Anonymous, Secure with Dpow, with slow atomic swaps from direct wallet to wallet.... Heat Fast and high speed trading with tokens.
All ICOs on SuperNET and on HeatWallet with their private chains can be exchanged in both heat and agama wallets. Adding liquidity to both platforms.
-----------------
disclosure heat and komodo are in my top 5 holdings ....

Author: ph03nix#3115
Content: @jl777c can crypto conditions be used to automate dividend payments?

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
a smart contract must be triggered by a transaction.  after it is triggered, whatever you want it to do. 
The comments for this rewards contract may be something of interest to you: https://github.com/jl777/komodo/blob/jl777/src/cc/rewards.cpp

(if you can't wait for an answer)

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: actually i just read the docs, it's more for locking coins and getting rewarded - not what you're after @ph03nix , apologies.  But the triggering statement still is true üòÉ

Author: ph03nix#3115
Content: thanks mylo

Author: ph03nix#3115
Content: i guess what i was referring to was SN assets

Author: ph03nix#3115
Content: like once the barterdex fee account reaches a certain level of kmd, it pays out automagically

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: ok in that instance, and you can wait for a 'james reply', but you need a tx to trigger the contract.  the contract can then check the balance of another address, and then do an evaluation based on the result of that query.  if > threshold, go into the dividend logic - sure.   providing there is sufficient permissions to unlock the funds from the calling contract, again yeah it's all tx, vins & vouts signed by keys that provide the answers to the cryptographic puzzles.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @Mylo the rewards CC is about locking coins and getting rewarded, since its the rewards contract

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: however, what happens after the coins are locked can be literally anything that can be coded. It would be possible to do a dividends contract, but I am a bit nervous about having to get consensus to the satoshi for thousands of payments. If your node is not current, it wont be able to validate it and if there is any problem with the DB it might go out of consensus. Maybe I am just being worried over nothing though as so far all seems to be in sync across the contracts, even after reorgs

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: The bigger issue with DEX dividend would be the cross chain nature also from a practical point it just seems easier to manually trigger a dividend payout with normal sendmany transactions. then it sidesteps needing to deal with massive tx vector with CC contract

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: for assets that are getting revenues to a single address, the easiest would just be to collect it in a CC address directly, which would have rules that only a dividend payout is acceptable way of doing a payout

Author: FishyGuts#5085
Content:
I had a shower thought this morning, Since KMD has privacy on transactions, is there privacy on the asset chains, the smart contracts and information?
What about a partnership with Enigma?  They just released their test net and it would be an amazing logical next step for KMD to really make CryptoConditions take off.

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @FishyGuts asset chains have all the features of the main KMD chain, such as shielded transactions, zaddrs, z_sendmany/etc

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @FishyGuts smart contracts mostly operate on transparent addresses, but part of a smart contract could be "send X to this zaddr", and then the funds are shielded. But the smart contracts themselves, they are stored in the public part of the blockchain

Author: FishyGuts#5085
Content: So you've got the majority of it covered.  What about shielding the smart contracts?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: James can answer in more detail, but that is how I understand it. I just started working on the test suite + continuous integration for CryptoConditions

Author: FishyGuts#5085
Content: I think that would help alot more people feel comfortable with real world transactions of that nature.

Author: FishyGuts#5085
Content: Enigma is basically doing that, to my knowledge.    Smart contract privacy.

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: the final action could be "Send to this zaddr", and that person has privacy. But all the detail of exactly how the smart contract works, needs to be public so the network can read it, verify it, etc

Author: FishyGuts#5085
Content: I could even offer it to my customers if there was a way to run it through a clearing house to convert their monthly payments to fiat.  A Smart contract for autopay would be fantastic.

Author: FishyGuts#5085
Content: But the contract has to have shielding, or thats gonna be a hard sell in my real estate world.

Author: FishyGuts#5085
Content: As a side note, every time I think of KMD I just get excited for the future of blockchain tech and this project in particular.  Keep it up! üé≤

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: @FishyGuts if you sent me KMD by transparent address, then i sent your customer KMD by z-addr, all that is known is that i sent to an amount to a z-addr.    Replace "i sent" with "contract sends".  Your customer still has privacy.

Author: FishyGuts#5085
Content: So how does the smart contract work in a case where say, a client signs up for automatic monthly payments?  Is their information for their loan servicing contract kept private?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: need a bit more details on exactly what the contract needs to do. You can send payments to a CC address and then restrict how it is able to be spent. from what you describe, what is missing is where the funds for the automatic monthly payments comes from. If it is all funded upfront, then it wouldnt be hard at all. the rule for payout would simply be, every month pay address X, a certain amount.  And it would be setup so either your node or the receipient node can collect the monthly payment

Author: jl777c#5810
Content:
the current examples are all variations on:
1. create a plan
2. add funds to the plan
3. payout funds the plan according to some specifiic set of rules

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I guess we could define a payments CC, where anybody at anytime could create a plan and add funds to it as they have it. Separately, they would create/cancel? autopayments, which would authorize spending funds from the locked amounts

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: this would allow to collect earnings into a single address and not have to worry about sending payments out
